comment_body:
auto generated methods:

```c
/* Generic Quad API */

sai_status_t sai_metadata_generic_create(
        _In_ const sai_apis_t* apis,
        _Inout_ sai_object_meta_key_t *meta_key,
        _In_ sai_object_id_t switch_id,
        _In_ uint32_t attr_count,
        _In_ const sai_attribute_t *attr_list);

sai_status_t sai_metadata_generic_remove(
        _In_ const sai_apis_t* apis,
        _In_ const sai_object_meta_key_t *meta_key);

sai_status_t sai_metadata_generic_set(
        _In_ const sai_apis_t* apis,
        _In_ const sai_object_meta_key_t *meta_key,
        _In_ const sai_attribute_t *attr);

sai_status_t sai_metadata_generic_get(
        _In_ const sai_apis_t* apis,
        _In_ const sai_object_meta_key_t *meta_key,
        _In_ uint32_t attr_count,
        _Inout_ sai_attribute_t *attr_list);


/* Generic Stats API */

sai_status_t sai_metadata_generic_get_stats(
        _In_ const sai_apis_t* apis,
        _In_ const sai_object_meta_key_t *meta_key,
        _In_ uint32_t number_of_counters,
        _In_ const sai_stat_id_t *counter_ids,
        _Out_ uint64_t *counters);

sai_status_t sai_metadata_generic_get_stats_ext(
        _In_ const sai_apis_t* apis,
        _In_ const sai_object_meta_key_t *meta_key,
        _In_ uint32_t number_of_counters,
        _In_ const sai_stat_id_t *counter_ids,
        _In_ sai_stats_mode_t mode,
        _Out_ uint64_t *counters);

sai_status_t sai_metadata_generic_clear_stats(
        _In_ const sai_apis_t* apis,
        _In_ const sai_object_meta_key_t *meta_key,
        _In_ uint32_t number_of_counters,
        _In_ const sai_stat_id_t *counter_ids);

/* Generic Quad Bulk API */

sai_status_t sai_metadata_generic_bulk_create(
        _In_ const sai_apis_t* apis,
        _In_ sai_object_id_t switch_id,
        _In_ uint32_t object_count,
        _Inout_ sai_object_meta_key_t *meta_key,
        _In_ const uint32_t *attr_count,
        _In_ const sai_attribute_t **attr_list,
        _In_ sai_bulk_op_error_mode_t mode,
        _Out_ sai_status_t *object_statuses);

sai_status_t sai_metadata_generic_bulk_remove(
        _In_ const sai_apis_t* apis,
        _In_ uint32_t object_count,
        _In_ const sai_object_meta_key_t *meta_key,
        _In_ sai_bulk_op_error_mode_t mode,
        _Out_ sai_status_t *object_statuses);

sai_status_t sai_metadata_generic_bulk_set(
        _In_ const sai_apis_t* apis,
        _In_ uint32_t object_count,
        _In_ const sai_object_meta_key_t *meta_key,
        _In_ const sai_attribute_t *attr_list,
        _In_ sai_bulk_op_error_mode_t mode,
        _Out_ sai_status_t *object_statuses);

sai_status_t sai_metadata_genecic_bulk_get(
        _In_ const sai_apis_t* apis,
        _In_ uint32_t object_count,
        _In_ const sai_object_meta_key_t *meta_key,
        _In_ const uint32_t *attr_count,
        _Inout_ sai_attribute_t **attr_list,
        _In_ sai_bulk_op_error_mode_t mode,
        _Out_ sai_status_t *object_statuses);

typedef void* (*sai_dlsym_fn) (void * handle, const char* name);
typedef char* (*sai_dlerror_fn) (void);
extern sai_status_t sai_metadata_global_apis_query(
        _Inout_ sai_global_apis_t* global_apis,
        _In_ void* handle,
        _In_ const sai_dlsym_fn sym,
        _In_ const sai_dlerror_fn error);
```

> So this is not necessay since usually its used like #include sai.h #include experimental.h

@kcudnik 
The commands as follow cause errors in logs because of this implicit dependency
```
cd sonic-sairedis && git submodule update --init
./autogen.sh
dpkg-buildpackage -us -uc -b --target=binary-syncd-vs
```

But we can easily avoid this implicit dependency which is a bad practice anyway. So, why not?

BTW, "saitypes.h" is also included in "sai.h" but still included in these experimental headers.

@kcudnik @JaiOCP could you review the changes please?
removing those conditions is a breaking backward compatibility change, since studently those 2 attributes will be required mandatory when creating tunnel term table entry

Confirmed that the attributes SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_DST_IP is MANDATORY_ON_CREATE only when the condition is met. So my change is not really necessary. It is completely ok to pass SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_DST_IP for other tunnel types.
*
     * @brief Tunnel termination IP address
     *
     * @type sai_ip_address_t
     * @flags MANDATORY_ON_CREATE | CREATE_ONLY
     * @condition SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_TYPE == SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_TYPE_P2P or SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_TYPE == SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_TYPE_P2MP
     */
    SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_DST_IP,

@JaiOCP Please help sign off this.
@mholankar can you see the comment on test failure. It seems PR checkers are passing here.

My apologies, the test that was failing is in SONiC sairedis not SAI. @kcudnik this appears to be BCM56971B0/acl_limit.rec, which is making use of the fact that the default SRC_IP mask is 0.0.0.0, so SRC_IP does not need to be specified for SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_TYPE_P2MP.

Example entry:
```
2022-03-22.05:32:44.773768|c|SAI_OBJECT_TYPE_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY:oid:0x2b0000000014ed|SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_VR_ID=oid:0x300000000007c|SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_TYPE=SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_TYPE_P2MP|SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_TUNNEL_TYPE=SAI_TUNNEL_TYPE_IPINIP|SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_ACTION_TUNNEL_ID=oid:0x2a0000000014ec|SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_DST_IP=192.168.0.1
```

> My apologies, the test that was failing is in SONiC sairedis not SAI. @kcudnik this appears to be BCM56971B0/acl_limit.rec, which is making use of the fact that the default SRC_IP mask is 0.0.0.0, so SRC_IP does not need to be specified for SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_TYPE_P2MP.
> 
> Example entry:
> 
> ```
> 2022-03-22.05:32:44.773768|c|SAI_OBJECT_TYPE_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY:oid:0x2b0000000014ed|SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_VR_ID=oid:0x300000000007c|SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_TYPE=SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_TYPE_P2MP|SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_TUNNEL_TYPE=SAI_TUNNEL_TYPE_IPINIP|SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_ACTION_TUNNEL_ID=oid:0x2a0000000014ec|SAI_TUNNEL_TERM_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_DST_IP=192.168.0.1
> ```

its not the only test that fail, its about 237 lines of tests that will fail because now this change will require to DST_IP and SRC_IP to be passed every time, which is not required now, please reffer to https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-swss/issues/2829

@kcudnik these are the changes I made in the tests. We were able to pass the tests locally. Here is the pull request for reference
https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-sairedis/pull/1255

@kcudnik 

Can you please point to the readme with explanation and examples.

During the community review, Rita suggested to create a document with examples as to how to handle the case where we need to change the size of an existing struct (for example, when we need add a new field in a key like sai_fdb_entry_t).
You were suggesting an approach of creating a new version like sai_fdb_entry_v2_t etc. It would be helpful if you can add those examples.

the whole point its you CAN'T change the structures, from that commit, size of structures, members sizes and types and order are constant. Please refer to description of this PR, if something is unclear, i will explain.

I think if you want to create new entry members, just copy one of existing one, add what you need, add specific objects, etc, bring up PR, and we will be discussing your changes.

Introduced a switch scoped attribute to trigger Fabric switch isolation for upgrade or RMA.

If SAI_SWITCH_ATTR_SWITCH_ISOLATE is set to true, it overrides isolation setting at port level.

I am not sure I follow the requirement for json
In the mentioned PR
https://github.com/sonic-net/SONiC/blob/5677242770e3774a5eab0f951dc14642d81422ec/doc/event-alarm-framework/events-producer.md
Sonic is moving to this model, to define the contract between Sonic and external tools on top of Sonic

I didn't understand the comment (intentionally excluded) on SAI_BFD_SESSION_ATTR_TUNNEL_DST_IP_ADDRESS. The condition attached to this attributed needs to be updated.

> I didn't understand the comment (intentionally excluded) on SAI_BFD_SESSION_ATTR_TUNNEL_DST_IP_ADDRESS. The condition attached to this attributed needs to be updated.

May have added more confusion with the original comment. To rephrase - SAI_BFD_SESSION_ATTR_TUNNEL_DST_IP_ADDRESS still only applies to IPinIP not this new attribute. For this reason I left the condition unchanged.

> > I didn't understand the comment (intentionally excluded) on SAI_BFD_SESSION_ATTR_TUNNEL_DST_IP_ADDRESS. The condition attached to this attributed needs to be updated.
> 
> May have added more confusion with the original comment. To rephrase - SAI_BFD_SESSION_ATTR_TUNNEL_DST_IP_ADDRESS still only applies to IPinIP not this new attribute. For this reason I left the condition unchanged.

Thanks. I still don't get why the original attribute is conditional for IP-in-IP and not IP-GRE tunnels.

> > > I didn't understand the comment (intentionally excluded) on SAI_BFD_SESSION_ATTR_TUNNEL_DST_IP_ADDRESS. The condition attached to this attributed needs to be updated.
> > 
> > 
> > May have added more confusion with the original comment. To rephrase - SAI_BFD_SESSION_ATTR_TUNNEL_DST_IP_ADDRESS still only applies to IPinIP not this new attribute. For this reason I left the condition unchanged.
> 
> Thanks. I still don't get why the original attribute is conditional for IP-in-IP and not IP-GRE tunnels.

I agree. This seems to be a miss from the original PR that introduced SAI BFD specification.
It would be better to track this miss in a different PR .

Hi @ashutosh-agrawal, is there anything else we need to address in this PR? or are you OK to approve? 

I would like to leave the condition for IP-GRE tunnels untouched as it does not directly related to this PR, and can be taken care of in a followup commit.

Can we add the below list in beginning of doc, as list of enhancements added in this release:

SAI GPE header files (#1585) 
SAI Generic Programmable Extensions proposal (#1551) 
Allow for CREATE_ONLY attributes in non objects (#1616) 

Bulk API for setting Port Attributes (#1460)
Bulk API support for Neighbor entries (#1504) 
Add bulk create and remove for tunnel (#1462) 

Add hostif traps for p4runtime and gNMI protocols (#1436) 
Add hostif trap for NTP (#1453) 
ECMP Member Capability and Configuration (#1461) 
Add DONOTDROP packet action. (#1349) 
Support counters on IP MC route entries. (#1497)
Tunnel UDP SRC PORT security (#1455) 

saiport: add support for link training ability query (#1434) 
Add port FEC histogram counter support. (#1617) 
Add fabric port isolation attribute (#1498) 
Add switch api for clause 22 mdio access (#1507) 

Update saitam.h (#1496) 
Distributed HW resource management infrastructure (#1528) 

Changes for supporting some PHY Diagnostics (#1527) 

SAI metadata enhancements
[meta] Add enum for global apis (#1456)
[meta] Add test to verify if vendor implemented all global apis (#1542) 
[meta] Disable doxygen TCL_SUBST and COLS_IN_ALPHA_INDEX (#1457) 
[meta] Add sai_status_t to ancestry check (#1501)

One way to expose device capability that only contiguous bits can be specified in table level valid bits (SAI\_ACL\_TABLE\_ATTR\_FIELD\_VALID\_BITS\_DST\_IPV6) is to have a new field in sai\_acl\_capability\_t like:

1.  bool is\_non\_contiguous\_exact\_match\_supported

> One way to expose device capability that only contiguous bits can be specified in table level valid bits (SAI_ACL_TABLE_ATTR_FIELD_VALID_BITS_DST_IPV6) is to have a new field in sai_acl_capability_t like:
> 
> 1. bool is_non_contiguous_exact_match_supported

I am not sure whether there is a use case currently for supporting non contiguous valid bits. Let me know if you prefer to add it regardless

> > One way to expose device capability that only contiguous bits can be specified in table level valid bits (SAI_ACL_TABLE_ATTR_FIELD_VALID_BITS_DST_IPV6) is to have a new field in sai_acl_capability_t like:
> > 
> > 1. bool is_non_contiguous_exact_match_supported
> 
> I am not sure whether there is a use case currently for supporting non contiguous valid bits. Let me know if you prefer to add it regardless

Added the capability discovery for non contiguous bit mapping in PR1730 which is the one that added EM

1) can you please specify if all acl actions applicable to ingress stage are applicable to post ingress as well? or is there restriction for any of them?
2) can you please specify expected behavior of result action when packet is a match in both ingress stage and post-ingress stage.
eg. if there is a packet match in ingress stage as well post-ingress and each stage resulting actions are different mirror session ids, what should be an expected behavior?

> 1. can you please specify if all acl actions applicable to ingress stage are applicable to post ingress as well? or is there restriction for any of them?
> 2. can you please specify expected behavior of result action when packet is a match in both ingress stage and post-ingress stage.
>    eg. if there is a packet match in ingress stage as well post-ingress and each stage resulting actions are different mirror session ids, what should be an expected behavior?

Thanks for the comments.
1. The spec do not specify and restrictions for match or action types in post ingress stage. If implementations cannot support certain action type, it will be reflected in the capability query for the stage just like existing stages. https://github.com/opencomputeproject/SAI/blob/master/inc/saitypes.h#L809
2. Since post ingress stage is the later one, the actions from post ingress will override the actions from ingress stage in case of conflict

@jiahua-wang , @tushar-ty , @eddyk-nvidia, @rlhui - if there are no objections - please merge this PR.

Hi,

Objective of PR: When a physical interface's operational status change, how should host interface'e operational status be updated?

It is not clear to us what SAI/SONiC agreed-upon/expected path to update the host interface operational state is when physical interface's operational status changes, so opening this PR to initiate that discuss and get consensus on that.

When physical interface's operation status changes, which component controls the update of operational status of host interface? 

1) Does portsOrch control the update of host interface operational state using sai_hostif_api API (SAI_HOSTIF_ATTR_OPER_STATUS) when OrchAgent receives physical interface's operational status change notification? or
2)  is it expected for some other components (for example: vendor SAI/SDK) to internally control and update the host interface operational state and thus making portsOrch's sai_hostif_api 
 API (SAI_HOSTIF_ATTR_OPER_STATUS) call pretty much as override call that vendor SAI may honor or just ignore it as no-op? or
3) something else.

Thank you.
CC:  @eddyk-nvidia @mikeberesford @lguohan
@marian-pritsak , woudl you like to review/approve this?  Thanks.

Syncd Notification Consumer upon getting the link status change from SAI sends  SAI_SWITCH_NOTIFICATION_NAME_PORT_STATE_CHANGE event which is handled by Notification Consumer in PortsOrch::doTask. This task calls setHostIntsOperStatus() which eventually invokes the SAI-Redis API sai_hositf_api->set_hostif_attribute() with SAI_HOSTIF_ATTR_OPER_STATUS. So, IMO your #1 in the original comment is correct

Hi,

As discussed in the last SAI meeting for the PR, based on the feedback provided I have updated the PR to add the attributes to support modes to update the host interface's operational status. Please take a look.

Thank you.

@Ashish1805  

Thanks for adding the document.

I have a follow up question regarding how the hostif is to be created in  SAI\_SWITCH\_HOSTIF\_OPER\_STATUS\_UPDATE\_MODE\_APPLICATION mode.

When the application calls create\_hostif(), how should the SAI\_HOSTIF\_ATTR\_OPER\_STATUS value be set?

\[Option A\]  Is it the application's responsibility to query the underlying physical port's state and fill the SAI\_HOSTIF\_ATTR\_OPER\_STATUS passed to create\_hostif()?

\[Option B\] The application does not pass SAI\_HOSTIF\_ATTR\_OPER\_STATUS, and the SAI implementation should update the initial SAI\_HOSTIF\_ATTR\_OPER\_STATUS based on the underlying port's status. This option may necessitate changes in the spec.

> > Hi @marian-pritsak @rck-innovium @rlhui, I have updated the PR based on all the feedbacks. Please TAL when you get a chance. Thank you.
> 
> @Ashish1805  
> 
> Thanks for adding the document.
> 
> I have a follow up question regarding how the hostif is to be created in  SAI_SWITCH_HOSTIF_OPER_STATUS_UPDATE_MODE_APPLICATION mode.
> 
> When the application calls create_hostif(), how should the SAI_HOSTIF_ATTR_OPER_STATUS value be set?
> 
> [Option A]  Is it the application's responsibility to query the underlying physical port's state and fill the SAI_HOSTIF_ATTR_OPER_STATUS passed to create_hostif()?
> 
> [Option B] The application does not pass SAI_HOSTIF_ATTR_OPER_STATUS, and the SAI implementation should update the initial SAI_HOSTIF_ATTR_OPER_STATUS based on the underlying port's status. This option may necessitate changes in the spec.

In SAI_SWITCH_HOSTIF_OPER_STATUS_UPDATE_MODE_APPLICATION mode when hostif created using create_hostif(), It is application's responsibility to query the corresponding physical interface's state from whatever source of truth is for them and update the state for hostif with SAI_HOSTIF_ATTR_OPER_STATUS either in same create_hostif() call or using hostif set_hostif_attribute() API after create_hostif() call depending on NOS's implementation.
